ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., ''Thinking of your entire lifetime'' or ''Since April 1, 2020''

ElementDescription: How often [nas_recall] did you drink enough to feel drunk?
Notes: 1 = Every day or nearly every day; 2 = Three to four times a week; 3 = Once or twice a week; 4 = Once to three times a month; 5 = Less than once a month; 6 = Once [nas_recall]; 7 = Never [nas_recall]; 97 = Don't know; 99 = No answer/prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: How many drinks does it take you to feel drunk?
Notes: 1 through 96=Number of drinks; 97=Don't Know; 99=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Have you driven a car or any other vehicle at any time [nas_recall]?
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No; 97 = Don't know; 99 = No answer/prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: (ASK IF NAS_A19D=01) [nas_recall], have you driven a car when you had drunk enough to be in trouble if the police had stopped you?
Notes: 1 = Yes; 2 = No; 97 = Don't know; 99 = No answer/prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: (ASK IF NAS_A19D=01) About how many drinks do you think you can have, over a two hour period, before your ability to drive becomes impaired? By impaired we mean you had too much to drink to drive safely.
Notes: 1 through 96=Number of drinks; 97=Don't Know; 99=No Answer/Prefer Not to Answer
